course_title: Spec. Tops in Sociology: Qualitative Research Methods
seats: Seats: Maximum Enrollment: 19 / Seats Avail: 19Waitlist Total: 0
class_notes: This course provides a thorough introduction to qualitative research methods in the social sciences. Students will actively engage in meaningful exploration, integration, and critical application of relevant topics. More specifically, through hands-on activities and assignments, students will learn the key principles, theories, and concepts underpinning qualitative research. We will discuss practical topics such as 1) developing qualitative research questions, 2) designing feasible projects, 3) sampling and recruiting participants, 4) collecting, preparing, and analyzing data, and 5) presenting findings. Students will have the opportunity to apply knowledge and skills in the development of qualitative study design and the implementation of specific qualitative methods (in-depth interviewing, focus group discussion, and observation) in applied settings.
course_description: A seminar or lecture series on topics of special sociological concern.
sections: Class Nbr: 3520, Section #: 4, Type: LEC, Campus: ATL, Meets: TTh 4-5:15p, Instructor: J. McDonnell, Status: Open
